summary: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide special rules for determining if financial guaranty insurance companies qualify as insurance corporations under passive foreign investment company (PFIC) rules. It clarifies how unearned premium reserves are treated, defines financial guaranty exposure and related terms and provides for reporting requirements and an effective date. Certain financial guaranty insurance companies will not be treated as PFICs retroactively under specific conditions. The Secretary of the Treasury is instructed to issue regulations and guidance.
